alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 9:31PM PST until December 08 at 8:12AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Forecast continued flooding for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM PST Thursday the stage was 26.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will hover near flood stage a bit longer, dropping below flood stage by 1 am Friday. The river will continue to recede on Friday. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 815 AM PST.
